seafood_collection.name: Mantis Shrimp
seafood_collection.habitat: Tropical and subtropical shallow waters of the Indo-Pacific
seafood_collection.fun_fact: Has the fastest punch in the animal kingdom - striking at 50mph with the force of a .22 caliber bullet, creating cavitation bubbles that reach 8,500Â°F!

seafood_collection.name: Pacific Geoduck
seafood_collection.habitat: Buried deep in sandy/muddy seafloor along Pacific Northwest coast
seafood_collection.fun_fact: Can live over 160 years and is one of the longest-living animals on Earth. Also has the world's most suggestive appearance for a clam.

seafood_collection.name: Flying Gurnard
seafood_collection.habitat: Tropical and warm temperate waters, walking along ocean floor on fin rays
seafood_collection.fun_fact: Despite the name, it doesn't actually fly but 'walks' along the seafloor on leg-like fins and can spread enormous, colorful pectoral fins like wings when threatened!

seafood_collection.name: Vampire Squid
seafood_collection.habitat: Deep ocean oxygen minimum zones, typically 600-900 meters deep in tropical and temperate seas
seafood_collection.fun_fact: Despite its terrifying name, it doesn't suck blood! It's a gentle scavenger that eats marine snow. When threatened, it turns itself inside-out like an umbrella, revealing bioluminescent organs and fleshy spines to scare predators.
